name: Project Tracker
subtitle: A MERN stack web application to track project progress.
description: This is a full stack web application, where users can track the progress of their projects. User can create project and assign various type of work items to it. Furthermore, work items can be assigned to users in the database.
note: The application is developed using TypeScript. It is hosted on Heroku. The database is connected to cloud.mongodb.com

name: Simple Weather
subtitle: A installable progressive web app built using React.js.
description: This is a single page app, where user can check weather condition of a city or current location. This is a progressive web app, where user can install this app on to their mobile or desktop devices. The app also offers unit type preference and dark mode in the settings.
note: Click on the plus ('+') button in browser search bar to install the app. If you're using it on mobile device, make sure you allow your browser to use your current geo-location.

name: React Portfolio
subtitle: A three page web app built using JavaScript and React.js
description: This is web app about myself, personal projects in portfolio, and a link to my resume. In the 'about me' page, you'll find a little bit information about my background and skillset. In the 'portfolio' page, you'll see the list of projects I've worked on and the tech stack I used. Lastly, in the 'resume' page, you can see my developer resume.
note: Try resizing the browser or view it on mobile device. The UI layout will adapt to the size of display for your convenience.

name: Employee Tracker
subtitle: A CLI application where user can access local mysql database.
description: This is a sample CLI application that user can add/edit/remove employees, roles, and teams from a database within the organization.

name: Order Up
subtitle: A full-stack application for restaurant owner and employees.
description: This is a full-stack application, using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js). Restaurant owner can add/edit/remove restaurant employees, menu items, and inventories. Employees such as servers and chefs can use the front end UI to take customer orders, pass them to chef for preparation, and check off the orders once they're made.
